title: Soufflé au Chocolat
ingredients: 50 g (¼ cup) unsalted butter, plus extra for greasing
2 tbsp sugar, plus extra for coating
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 200°C (390°F). Grease ramekins with butter and coat them with sugar to ensure an even rise.
2. Melt the chocolate and butter in a heatproof bowl over simmering water. Stir until smooth, then let it cool slightly.
3. Whisk the egg yolks and vanilla extract into the melted chocolate mixture until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form, gradually adding the sugar as you whisk.
5. Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the chocolate mixture in batches, being careful not to deflate the batter.
6. Divide the mixture evenly among the prepared ramekins. Bake for 10–12 minutes, or until the soufflés are risen and set on the outside but still molten inside.
7. Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately for the ultimate chocolate indulgence!
